Body: Hero Token Community Update (August 8, 2018)     Dear Hero Community,  Please join us in welcoming Rosalyn Charlton to the Hero team in the role of Chief Technology Officer and Product Champion! Throughout her 18 years in the software engineering industry Rosalyn has been recognized for applying well formulated strategies to enable teams to perform at their best, while ensuring business objectives are understood and met. She is an innovative and resourceful professional with a strong inclination for strategic problem solving. She applies a concrete knowledge of Software Engineering strategies, Agile methodologies and an innate ability to create enjoyable and effective team environments. Allocated Bullion Exchange was established in 2011 to develop the only online global precious metals exchange, offering a world first in single-platform trading across a number of hubs globally. Rosalyn spearheaded the development of these bespoke systems and the creation of specialist development teams to do so. Body: HERO Token Community Update (May 2nd)   Dear HERO Community,  We are happy to announce that we have now released over 99% of the Hero Origen Tokens to token sale participants. David, the founder of the Hero Project, has resigned from his operating role at PawnHero so he can focus 100% of his time and efforts on building the Hero Capital Market Platform. He has relocated from the Philippines to Europe where we will open an office in Barcelona, Spain and build the executive team for the Hero Project. We are in the process of hiring experienced blockchain developers and additional support staff to build and market the Hero Capital Market Platform in the Philippines and other markets in SEA. Please remember that the Hero Project is both a social venture to provide financial inclusion, transparency, and efficiency for the underserved populations of South East Asia, and a non-profit business that must like any business build its product and market it to its customers. Author: Hero_Token
Title: [ANN]Hero Token[ICO]-The Future of Banking in Southeast Asia | TOKEN SALE FEB 1
Body: HERO Token Community Update (April 20th)     Hello HERO Community!  The 5th batch of tokens were issued yesterday and around 30,923 HERO Tokens were distributed to members who solved their issues and got verified by April 18. As of the moment 217,063 HERO Tokens still remain in reserve post the release. We are still proactive in sending emails to the unverified accounts and continue to remind them to complete the KYC to get their tokens, but it is out of our hands if some people cannot follow simple instructions. In any case, if you still have issues with your tokens or problems with your accounts you can send an email to tokensale@herotoken.io with the complete details of your transaction and your problem.  For the remaining undistributed Bounty campaigns, the Translation bounty spreadsheet will be updated later today. It will be open to comments and disputes before it is distributed. Visit the official HERO Bounty group https://t.me/herotokenbounty for inquiries or message @andykov or @silviudis.  Regarding the exchange listing, we are still currently in talks with several top exchanges. But we want to consult the community regarding this matter. We are nearing an agreement with HUOBI and Bit-Z. However the listing process for both HUOBI and Bit-Z require an active participation from the community. Both would require a voting phase that will ask the community to buy voting tokens and vote for HERO in order for us to get into the exchanges.  Here are the Voting mechanics for HUOBI:  The voting phase shall be 11 days. Each round selects two projects to go live. The project that scores the first will obtain the priority in entering Huobi Pro listing audit. The winning projects need to get at least 600,000 points. Projects that enter the final list are required to have more than 1,000 voters. 1 vote costs 0.1 HT. Each user can cast 100,000 votes maximum.  https://huobiglobal.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/360000760471-Voting-Rules  Here are the Voting mechanics for Bit-Z:  In accordance with the listing rules, coins need to be voted to hit 2 million VTC (Votecoin) before getting listed. Each of your supporters or community members who registers on Bit-Z can vote 50–1000 VTC. VTC tokens can be purchased at DKKT market. The voting period is 7 days, which means the voting goal of 2 million VTC should be reached in 7 days. In case you fail the voting, VTC tokens will be refunded to the voters after the voting. If you succeed in the voting, VTC will not be refundable.  https://support.bit-z.pro/hc/en-us/articles/360002590973  Now because we know that voting is something that would need the undivided attention of the community, we want to focus on only one of them. So we will ask your feedback regarding this matter. Both of these voting schemes do not ensure that HERO would be listed on the exchanges, and we need to actually reach the voting goal of either 2 million VTC in 7 days for Bit-Z or 600,000 Points in 11 days for HUOBI to get listed. We want to ask the community if you are willing to take such a risk. And if you are, would you prefer the voting process of Bit-Z or HOUBI? If you choose among the two, the exchange listing would significantly speed up. But if you think that it be would be safer to go for an exchange without a voting phase, it would probably take a little longer to get listed. We will set up a Poll in the Official HERO Telegram group to gauge the community’s choice. We appreciate your help and the patience you have shown. We look forward to your decision.  In the meantime, we also want to address certain issues coming up in the Telegram group saying the team is not using the community’s contributions properly. We want to assure you that the funds from the ICO have very much been untouched. It is public for the community to see, thanks to the blockchain: https://etherscan.io/address/0x1706024467ef8c9c4648da6fc35f2c995ac79cf6  We want to assure you that we are very careful in our transactions and business decisions only because we have your best interest in mind. We ask that you allow us the necessary time to make the right and carefully considered business decisions we need to make. Rushing will not help anyone. It is still only a few weeks removed from the ICO closing, we have a lot in store for you to be revealed at the proper time.  Another concern we want to address is with the Token Price, extreme movements in both directions can be observed because the trading volume on QRYPTOS is insubstantial. It is still very early for HERO. Listing on a bigger exchange where all the token holders can access, together with platform development progress, will have a big impact on the value of the token.  In line with this, we have good news for those asking about the platform. We have significant information about the development of the HERO Capital Market in next week’s community update. Please stay tuned for that.  Finally, we want to ask everyone to join our new HERO Token Channel. Because updates and messages easily get buried in the main group, we decided to open a channel dedicated to the latest HERO news and updates. You can join the HERO Token Channel here: https://t.me/herotoken_channel  THANK YOU FOR YOUR CONTINUED TRUST AND SUPPORT!  Our team continues to be available for your questions and concerns through our Telegram group https://t.me/Herotokensale or via email tokensale@herotoken.io.  Until next Friday and Happy Weekend.  Best regards,  Your HERO Token Team  https://medium.com/@HeroToken/hero-token-community-update-april-20th-b99965f1fb5d

Author: Hero_Token
Title: [ANN]Hero Token[ICO]-The Future of Banking in Southeast Asia | TOKEN SALE FEB 1
Body: HERO Token Community Update (March 16th)  Hello HERO Community!    Majority (95%) of our tokens have already been distributed since March 9. The second round of tokens was successfully issued yesterday, March 15. 178.324 tokens were distributed to 1,153 wallets. We did not mint any additional tokens. Instead, those tokens were already minted and held in a reserve wallet. Thus, the token supply stays the same at 14,765,425.24871560000.  Members who received their tokens yesterday only completed their identity verification after the deadline for the first round of tokens, which was March 1. The next round of tokens will be issued on March 20 to all those that verify their account or clear their ongoing dispute before midnight on March 18. As this will be the third round of tokens issued, we will be leaving a bigger window to resolve any ongoing dispute and have the remaining members verify their account. Please be reminded to get your accounts verified and to settle your issues before March 18. If you fail to do so, you will further delay the token distribution. The fourth round of tokens will hopefully be the last and this is expected to take place in the middle of April.  We proactively reminded everybody to complete the KYC before the ICO ended and yet many still did not. This week alone, we verified and solved more than 1,000 accounts and disputes. That gives you an idea of what happens behind the scenes of an ICO. Transaction support is taking a lot of our time.  The most common problem we encounter these days is people who registered an account but sent their contribution from a different wallet. They would then contact us afterwards to ask why they did not get their tokens. Tokens are issued to the wallet from which we received the contribution from and only when there is a registered and verified account. You cannot use a different account that is registered under a different wallet address. If you have not received your tokens yet, this could be because you do not have any account (register now) or there is a dispute. Those disputes are usually related to members who bought HERO tokens with non-Ethereum, i.e. Bitcoin, Ripple, LTC etc., but did not provide the transaction signature to provide sufficient proof that they were the ones who made the transaction, or there are multiple people claiming to have made this transaction. Those members need to fill up the problem reporting form, complete all required fields, and upload supporting documents and screenshots from their wallet/exchange.  Again, we have repeatedly sent warnings to the community, yet members continue to make the same mistakes. Thus, it is beyond our control if people cannot follow our simple instructions. If you still have token concerns, please email tokensale@herotoken.io and make sure to include the complete details of your issue. Our average response time is less than 12 hours, while more complex issues take more time.  For Referral Program participants, we released the remaining tokens to those who had verified accounts. Again, you will need a verified account in order to receive tokens. We already emailed everyone who participated in the token sale and referral program whose account status are still not verified. Please make sure you follow the instructions in the said email.  We ask bounty participants to be patient as bounty tokens will be issued by the end of March at the earliest. Stakes will take a while to be calculated and have not been a priority. Bounty participants will receive their tokens only after all members who participated in the token sale have completed their KYC and received their tokens, so that the total number of tokens sold can be determined, which then provides the foundation to calculate the amount of tokens to be issued to bounty participants. Remember, the bounty pool is equal to 2% of all tokens sold. We were hoping that everybody would follow the instructions and complete the identity verification in time, but since this was not the case, all advisors, bounty participants and team members have to wait.  We also want to remind everyone that for issues with QRYPTOS, it is best to seek help from their support on Telegram: https://t.me/QUOINE_Support. To those of you complaining that QRYPTOS KYC takes a while to process, this is standard protocol for almost all exchanges. It is very difficult from them as well to cope with the high number of new registrations. The verification process of other exchanges take even longer, so we ask you to be patient (this is out of our control). We also want to remind Japanese people to send tokens on QRYPTOS because chances are that your account will not be verified and you will not be able to withdraw your tokens. That said, QRYPTOS only needs KYC if you want to withdraw funds, but not to buy/sell HERO and other tokens. So you can still buy/sell HERO Tokens even with a newly created account or simply check the token price.  Taking a step back, HERO ICO started on February 1 and ended on February 28. Most ICOs announce the listing on exchanges only weeks after the ICO ended. For example, LALA World ended its token sale on January 12 and only listed its first exchange two months later on March 12. We at HERO, on the other hand, were able to list on QRYPTOS before the ICO even started. Which we believe speaks for the team and project itself. But what we did not know and also could not (since the ICO had not started) was that 82% of all tokens would be sold to Japanese citizens.  Unfortunately QRYPTOS is not open to Japanese citizens. When over 80% of all token holders are unable to trade, then this explains the current trading volume, which has been low to almost nonexistent (only 10 ETH worth of HERO were traded in the last 24 hours). Aside from that, all major currencies and tokens are down significantly compared to the last few weeks. You can also see that the funds we raised have remained almost untouched apart from some marketing related expenses, though the value depreciated a lot as well.  The biggest concern of the community at the moment is getting listed on other exchanges after previously listing on QYRPTOS. We have and will always be transparent with the community. We are in talks with several reputable exchanges and have filed for listing, but like you we have to wait. Listing on an exchange takes time. Exchanges get tons of applications. As a result, certain exchanges are upgrading their policies and restrictions, thus, resulting to listing being more complicated than ever. This is why we are cautious before revealing any news to the community. Title: [ANN]Hero Token[ICO]-The Future of Banking in Southeast Asia | TOKEN SALE FEB 1
Body: HERO Token Community Update (March 10th)    Dear HERO Community,  As you may know, in the last 24 hours we distributed HERO to those whose accounts were verified before March 1st, with no dispute ongoing or problem reported, and those with transaction signature for those who didn’t buy with Ether. HERO was listed on a small but (very) fast growing exchange, QRYPTOS. We wanted to leave you with some food for thoughts about the token price. At the time of writing this blog post, there are buy orders for HERO tokens at a price of 0.0018 ETH. It is important to note that this solely shows the willingness of people to buy tokens and at what price and rather than being the value of your HERO token. That the trading price is below the ICO price can be explained by a combination of the following: a) ICO just ended and until the last day, February 28th, people were able to purchase tokens (hard cap was not reached) b) tokens have just been issued, everybody on Telegram and in the community have their tokens, therefore why buy more unless the price is attractive. Whereas the willingness to sell at a high price, and therefore the slight prominence on the “sell” side makes sense for everybody who holds HERO tokens right now. A lot of token holders would probably sell at 2x, 3x or 5x. Placing those orders therefore is totally legitimate. Now, when people argue that the trading price is below the ICO price, we have to start with what was the ICO price. Ethereum closed at $354.7 on November 20th, somebody who participated in the presale, remember minimum was 10 Ether with a bonus of 30% (first 3 hours) (10 * 354.7 = 3547.0 USD received 200 * 10 = 2,000 + 30% bonus = 2,600 HERO tokens) so effectively this person paid $1.36 per token. Whereas on the other hand somebody who bought on February 1 at a price per Ether of $1101.49 and 10% (no more minimum) paid $5.01 per token. Finally those who bought at the end of the ICO at a price of 870.44 USD per ETH and no more bonus paid effectively $4.35. Remember price per HERO was always 1 ETH = 200 HERO (plus applicable bonuses). It was a difficult call to decide at what price to list. Eventually together with the QRYPTOS team we decided to price at $4.7. Higher than what the average paid, providing a slight premium to those who participated during the ICO. So what happened today was that only (!) slightly more than 20,000 HERO tokens where both sold against each ETH and BTC. That is equal to 100 ETH each. This is nothing as compared to the 42,000 worth of Ether contributed during the ICO (less than half a percent). It would however make sense for referral participants, who potentially have their own expenses for marketing to sell HERO tokens at any price to cover their bills. Likewise it makes sense for somebody who came in in November during the presale to sell since Ethereum already appreciated 2x (during the ICO sometimes already 3x) against the price. This does not even take into account the current dip across the entire crypto market recently. It is not surprising to us that there are only relatively few buy orders and few people selling at a higher price. This shows that the big majority of HERO token owners are HODLing, which is the right thing to do in the absence of any major additional announcement since the ICO ended. We hope this explanation helps to understand today’s events. We are excited about the weeks and months ahead. It will be a long way to disrupt what banks couldn’t for hundreds of years but we accepted the challenge and out of it the HERO idea was born.  Thank you for your continuous support and trust. Have a good night.  Your HERO Token Team  https://medium.com/@HeroToken/hero-token-community-update-march-10th-c2b1eee1a4bb

Body: Hero Team Welcomes ex Managing Director of Goldman Sachs and UniCredit Bank  Hello, everyone!  We are pleased to announce two new advisers that will help with the success of Hero Token. We are glad to welcome Norbert Gehrke and Maurizio Raffone to the Hero Token advisory team.  Not only will their expertise bolster our team, but their experience will also prove invaluable as we move towards the exciting few months ahead.  Norbert Gehrke  Former Managing Director Goldman Sachs and Barclays  He is the current Senior Program Director in the Strategy Office of AIG Japan Holdings. With vast experience in the field of capital markets, he has held positions as the Managing Director of Goldman Sachs, Managing Director responsible for the Technology Programme Services (TPS) and Global Test Centre (GTC) teams at Barclays Investment Bank, and has served as a financial adviser of FinTech innovations all around the world. Norbert is the founder of Tokyo FinTech Meetup, a community of 900+ individuals exploring the different aspects of financial technology, innovation, and disruption. He also serves as an adjunct lecturer for New York University School of Professional Studies, Tokyo Campus. He holds a Master of Science degree in Computer Science and Business Administration from the University of Applied Sciences in Wedel, Germany. He is a Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA), Financial Risk Manager (FRM), and Professional Risk Manager (PRM).  Maurizio Raffone  Former Managing Director at UniCredit Bank AG  With over 20 years of experience in field of international finance with expertise in credit derivatives, structured finance, and fund management, Maurizio has held important positions such as the Managing Director of UniCredit Bank AG, as well as a Partner and co-Chief Investment Officer of TriSpan LLP’s global macro fund. Right now his current area of focus is the application of finance to advanced technologies. He holds a Master’s degree in Economics from the University of Cambridge and an honors degree in Economics and Management from Royal Holloway College of the University of London.  “The Hero Token project combines two of my main personal interests: the use of the latest blockchain technology with a strong social element aiming to democratize and expand access to finance, particularly in South East Asia. David’s great track-record speaks for itself and I am delighted to be part of this journey.” — Maurizio Raffone & Norbert Gehrke  With the addition of Norbert and Maurizio to our team of experts, we hope to be one step closer to achieving financial disruption in South East Asia through Hero Token. Author: ColorlessK
Title: [ANN]Hero Token[ICO]-The Future of Banking in Southeast Asia | TOKEN SALE FEB 1
Body: The Smart Token is now live on the github https://github.com/HeroToken/herotoken-ico   Dear Developers, Security and Blockchain Enthusiasts, this marks the beginning of the Hero Token Bug Bounty Hunt, we await your proposals and findings.  Full Announcement:  Hi Everyone,  We've written a smart contract through which you can purchase HERO tokens and want to take the opportunity to share it with you before the pre-sale is starting soon.  *--->>>  https://github.com/HeroToken/herotoken-ico <<<----*  HERO tokens are fully ERC20 compliant, and we expect to have them included on both the etherscan.io token listing and major exchanges. Unlike other ERC20 tokens, HERO tokens are modified for us to be able to distribute rewards to token owners pro rata. To purchase HERO tokens using ETH, you can simply send the ETH to the smart contract. The wallet from which the money is sent will immediately* receive the HERO tokens, but they will not be tradable until after the sale. For people who will be paying through other cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin, we will be manually issuing your tokens once we have confirmed the transaction details. We expect to be able to do this within three days of the end of the sale. After we have finished issuing all the tokens, we will enable the trading of HERO tokens and make an announcement.  Regarding rewards, we will be putting up a webpage where you can claim your share of distributed rewards. This page can also be used to check how much rewards you have with us. Please note that the rewards will be tied to the wallets which own the tokens at the time the rewards are distributed. In other words, transferring tokens will keep the current rewards with the original token owner but future rewards will be given to the new owner. For technical reasons, you will need to install a browser plugin like MetaMask in order for the page to be able to interact with the Ethereum network.  After this sale is over, no further HERO tokens can be minted due to how the contract is written.  * While this is different from what is written in our white paper it is positive development. From a practical point of view, this achieves the same thing as not giving the tokens until after the sale. But from a technical standpoint, we avoid the problem of the token handout at the end of the sale from running into the gas limit.  *This coming Monday we are announcing an Ask-Me-Anything (AMA) and hope to go into more details. *  _We welcome feedback from the community! You can learn more about our BUG-HUNT Bounty Program on Bitcointalk https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=2088859.0 _  Happy Weekend!  _PS. Title: [ANN]Hero Token[ICO]-The Future of Banking in Southeast Asia | TOKEN SALE FEB 1
Body: I have a few questions regarding this ICO.  (1) Assuming the top part of the whitepaper on page 17 is in USD, average monthly loan release is 7,745K. Int at 2.99% yields 231K of which up to 20% will be for the investors = 46K per month. Or ~555K for 2019. At max 50M HERO tokens, that translates to about 1 cent of income per token. At the current rate, each token ~$1.50... Is this correct?  (2) The whitepaper says "up to 20% of distributable interest income"... so it could be 0%? How is the actual percentage determined? Is it discretionary?  (3) Is the definition of "distributable interest income" as shown in the example on page 13 and not some accounting term that could essentially wipe this to be 0?  (4) Is there any protection in case of a buyout? For example, if PawnHero gets acquired by another company, does the new company have to follow the terms of HERO token contract? Or can they just say future distributable interest income will always be 0% since "up to" 20% will be distributed.  Any clarification will be appreciated. Thank you.

Title: [ANN]Hero Token[ICO]-The Future of Banking in Southeast Asia | TOKEN SALE FEB 1
Body: I am not aware of the profits that pawnhero made or the exact number of customers, someone else will have to answer that.  Regarding Blockchain, because if micro-loans are recorded to the blockchain and everyone can access them, then they can hold those more accountable for bad behavior. Blockchain as a technology, has the potential to address all these innate intricacies of the lending process.  With the inherent concept of open ledger, decentralized platform, smart contracts and integrated central database, blockchain achieves transparency, cost effectiveness, regulatory compliance and risk analysis in the lending process. By reducing manual reviews, data re-entry and systems reconciliation, the system provides the company with immediate cost savings. Loan data processing can be done exclusively on the distributed ledger reducing risk and increasing transparency and responsiveness, the technology itself functions like a regulation.  Regarding what the ICO proceeds will be used for, please refer to page 16 and onward from the Whitepaper since the full explanation is too lengthy to be put here.  The Token Distribution   80% of available token are for sale open to the public  • 3% of available token are for early believers and advisors  • 2% of available token are for bounties  • 15% of available token are allocated to the founders for long-term alignment of interests  While 15% might seem high, it ensures that the team has an incentive to continue to improve Hero Token, keep in mind ETH had 50% premine and look where it is at now. As for the Bounties, the total Pool is close to 2.000.000$, it is one of the largest Bounties ever to be offered on Bitcointalk, if not the largest, I do not understand how you can call that very very low... Even as a percentage, 2% of Total Sold Tokens is very generous, especially considering the high cap.  If you wish to find out more about Hero Token, try and give the Whitepaper a read, it explains a lot of things very clearly, including the reason behind the ICO and much more than that. The PawnHero Team is comprised of 28 full-time employees, besides being backed by companies such as Alibaba or Softbank and people like Nix Nolledo and Paul Rivera, and they are here to do something useful. There are more people with a facebook account than a bank account, that is why this business needs the blockchain and why the blockchain needs this business.
